questions.question_text:
Some members of a project team are frustrated by a new team member who previously worked in a Scrum setting. This new team member approaches members of the project team on a daily basis in what appears to be an attempt to engage in individual standup meetings.
What should the project manager do?

choices.A: Schedule a meeting for the project team to review the communications management plan.
choices.C: Send an email to the project team outlining the communications strategy.
choices.B: Tell the rest of the project team to continue discussions with the new team member.
choices.D: Mentor the new team member on the methodology the project team is using.

comments.content: yes, the new member only though scrum practise is the best and would like to push it to the team.. However, there is no the best, whether it should use agile or predictive is organisation to organisation and project to project. It is PM's responsibility to make the new member to understand the team normal and practise before putting any personal idea to the team. It is a team conflict in this case

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
I will go with D.
The problem is with the new team member, he needs to learn and understand the way this team works.

Selected Answer: D
Gonna go with D, since the team is fine, its this specific member thats the root cause.

Selected Answer: A
I go with A. Mentoring the new team member is valid. But reviewing communication management plan with entire team is the permanent solution and also ensures the same is not repeated by any other team member in future.

Selected Answer: D
D address the actual issue directly, A will come in if D won't work.

Selected Answer: D
D. Mentor the new team member on the methodology the project team is using
A new team member that lacks understanding and direction needs to be mentored or coached by the PM.
the answer is A, as the team member frustrated the need to review the communications management plan they might be wrong and the new team member is professional and new add value to the team
D is correct

comments.content: Agree. This is a issue for a member in the team.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct

questions.question_text:
An organization is transitioning to agile and a project has been chosen as a pilot. The assigned project manager only has experience using predictive approaches, but the project manager is now required to use agile approaches with the help of an agile coach. During the retrospective of the fifth sprint, the project team complains that many obstacles exist with the organization that are creating project delays and rework.
What should the project manager do in this situation?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is PMP spirit, empower team collaboration

Selected Answer: D
I don't think its A or B, as standup is generally a status updates and of 15 mins. Root cause analysis and impediment resolutions are done after standup by the coach/scrum master. D looks promising answer here.

Selected Answer: D
D. Promote collaboration to help remove the obstacles for the team

Selected Answer: C
Why we don't use an iteration as a spike to resolve these issues?
There are many not needed information in this question!!

Selected Answer: D
I will stay with D.

Selected Answer: D
I think D is correct. I don't think its A because including the resolutions during a standup isn't something that would help remove an obstacle. I also don't think its B, because you don't typically do a root cause analysis during a standup meeting, you would identify them, and then perform the root cause analysis at another meeting. D seems like the best answer here.

comments.content: why is A correct why can't B the correct answer?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
A is right

choices.B: Perform a root cause analysis during the standup meetings
choices.D: Promote collaboration to help remove the obstacles for the team
choices.A: Include impediment resolutions during daily standup meetings
choices.C: Create a dedicated sprint to solve the obstacles with the team

choices.B: Add multiple layers of managers who will be accountable for the agile execution.
choices.C: Improve organizational readiness by addressing impediments to agile in the organization.
choices.A: Create a task force of executives who will monitor agile projects on a daily basis.
choices.D: Take a big bang approach of moving the whole organization to agile at once.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
C. Improve organizational readiness by addressing impediments to agile in the organization

Selected Answer: C
Agile transformation should be executed with a big-bang approach. It should be a smooth transitioning by removing impediments and bringing the org up to speed on the new way of working

questions.question_text:
An integrated project involves the interaction of both hardware and software and the sponsor has approved the schedule management plan. The project team evaluated the product's feasibility of functionality and accelerated testing.
What should the project manager do as a servant leader?

choices.D: Develop the product as per the schedule to perform integration and testing.
choices.C: Submit a change request to the project sponsor for accelerated testing.
choices.B: Amend the project budget to include MVP testing.
choices.A: Support the team as necessary to find the minimum viable product (MVP).

choices.D: Talk to the program manager and about prioritizing this project over other projects so the key resources are available
choices.B: Have a meeting with project manager of the other project to find a resource optimization solution that works for both projects
choices.A: Pay overtime to key resource to get the work done outside of working hours
choices.C: Speak with the client to see if the project delivery deadline can be delayed due to resource availability

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B. Have a meeting with project manager of the other project to find a resource optimization solution that works for both projects
